cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (35 mph – not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi (125 km) south of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to accelerate northwest across the north-western Caribbean, cross western Cuba Tuesday, then move north-westward across the central Gulf toward the north-west Gulf Coast late Thursday-Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central to south-western Louisiana coast (near Lake Charles-Vermilion Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for the Cuban provinces of Pinar del Rio, Artemisa and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch for La Habana, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Cayman Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-western Caribbean, Yucatan Channel, eastern Gulf of Mexico, and north-west Gulf coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (currently forecast <3 ft for upper TX coast)
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (8% cumulative) of sustained 34-kt winds late Thursday into Friday; gusty squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge and elevated tides possible but currently forecast below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring 1–3 in of rain late week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, higher waves and dangerous rip currents beginning late Thursday.
